headline: Meta investors, Zuckerberg settle $8 billion privacy suit
summary: STORY: Meta Platforms' investors and CEO Mark Zuckerberg reached a settlement Thursday to end the $8 billion trial over Facebook users' privacy.The trial was scheduled to run all week, but was adjourned just as it was about to enter its second day.The case began in 2018, following revelations that data from millions of Facebook users was accessed by Cambridge Analytica, a now-defunct political consulting firm that worked for Donald Trump's successful U.S. presidential campaign in 2016.Zuckerberg and current and former directors and officers of Meta Platforms agreed to settle for the damage they allegedly caused the company by allowing the privacy breach.Facebook changed its name to Meta in 2021. Meta was not a defendant and declined to comment.The parties did not disclose details of the settlement.The shareholders' lawyer, Sam Closic, said the agreement came together quickly.It was reached before any high-profile executives like Zuckerberg or former Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg were to testify.In 2017, Zuckerberg was expected to testify at a trial involving another lawsuit by company investors, but that case was also settled before he took the stand.A lawyer for the defendants did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

raw.headline: Meta investors, Zuckerberg settle $8 billion privacy suit
raw.summary: STORY: Meta Platforms' investors and CEO Mark Zuckerberg reached a settlement Thursday to end the $8 billion trial over Facebook users' privacy.The trial was scheduled to run all week, but was adjourned just as it was about to enter its second day.The case began in 2018, following revelations that data from millions of Facebook users was accessed by Cambridge Analytica, a now-defunct political consulting firm that worked for Donald Trump's successful U.S. presidential campaign in 2016.Zuckerberg and current and former directors and officers of Meta Platforms agreed to settle for the damage they allegedly caused the company by allowing the privacy breach.Facebook changed its name to Meta in 2021. Meta was not a defendant and declined to comment.The parties did not disclose details of the settlement.The shareholders' lawyer, Sam Closic, said the agreement came together quickly.It was reached before any high-profile executives like Zuckerberg or former Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg were to testify.In 2017, Zuckerberg was expected to testify at a trial involving another lawsuit by company investors, but that case was also settled before he took the stand.A lawyer for the defendants did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

headline: Settlement reached in investors’ lawsuit against Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and other company leaders
summary: A settlement was announced Thursday in court in a class action investors’ lawsuit against Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and current and former company leaders over claims stemming from the privacy scandal involving the Cambridge Analytica political consulting firm.  No details on the settlement were shared when it was announced in Delaware’s Court of Chancery at the start of what would have been the second day of trial, at which point nothing related to the settlement had been filed with the court.  A communications representative from Meta said the company had no comment.

raw.headline: Settlement reached in investors’ lawsuit against Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and other company leaders
raw.summary: A settlement was announced Thursday in court in a class action investors’ lawsuit against Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and current and former company leaders over claims stemming from the privacy scandal involving the Cambridge Analytica political consulting firm.  No details on the settlement were shared when it was announced in Delaware’s Court of Chancery at the start of what would have been the second day of trial, at which point nothing related to the settlement had been filed with the court.  A communications representative from Meta said the company had no comment.

headline: SCAD Publishes New Foundational AI Insights Report, Accelerating AI Literacy through Human Creativity
summary: The Savannah College of Art and Design (SCAD) is proud to present the release of its 2025 SCAD AI Insights Report, developed by the university's leading research team SCADask. Since 1978, SCAD has consistently adopted technologies to ensure students have the tools necessary to launch their creative professions. AI, an invention that augments and amplifies human productivity, is the next chapter in SCAD's legacy of design innovation.

headline: Exclusive-Amazon's AWS cloud computing unit cuts at least hundreds of jobs, sources say
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Amazon cut at least hundreds of jobs in its Amazon Web Services cloud computing unit on Thursday, two sources said, just a month after CEO Andy Jassy warned that adoption of generative AI tools would trigger a workforce reduction.  An Amazon spokesperson confirmed it had cut jobs but did not provide a number.  Amazon, which employed 1.6 million full- and part-time workers globally as of the end of March, has joined a growing list of firms, including Microsoft, Meta, and CrowdStrike in announcing layoffs this year.

Amazon, which employed 1.6 million full- and part-time workers globally as of the end of March, has joined a growing list of firms, including Microsoft, Meta, and CrowdStrike in announcing layoffs this year.

headline: Meta investors, Zuckerberg reach settlement to end trial over Facebook privacy litigation
